h any
pro-choicer will agree. There are plainly good reasons to treat with care and
consideration the fetuses we intend to keep. This is quite compatible with
aborting those fetuses we intend to discard. Thus, Feinberg’s account of the
wrongness of infanticide is inadequate.
Accordingly, we can see that a contractarian defense of the pro-choice
personhood syllogism fails. The problem arises because the contractarian
cannot account for our duties to individuals who are not persons, whether
